content.description: Rarely traveled, mossy in spots, but actually not half bad (just about a quarter bad, really). Walk up a layback ramp/crack past a bolt, pull some easy moves and clip another bolt, then it actually becomes fun with 25' of 5" crack. Use small face holds or practice your 5.7 offwidth moves. It's actually a nice jaunt if you can handle a healthy serving of moss, and definitely my recommended approach to Babble-On.
content.protection:
Two draws, and #3, 4, and 5 cam.

If you didn't bring a #5, you can bump the #4 up to a solid .75, then place the #4 tipped out later. Optional crappy #3 also.
content.location: This is the first route you see as you arrive at the aretes. It starts at a very wide crack/ramp to the right of the trail as you turn towards the Boardwalk.

content.description: Thin climbing broken up by a small ledge.  First crux is a long move before the ledge, second crux is getting to the last bolt after the ledge.  Still a little loose but pretty fun climbing.
content.protection: 8 bolts, 2 bolt anchor.  This used to be an r.b. route.
content.location: Lone route on the lower (north?) face of Tower of Babble, you'll pass by it on the way to the upper Shooting Gallery.  Bolt hangers are camouflaged grey, and are a little hard to see at first.

content.description:
The Shard ascends the spire-like formation on the right edge of the Tower of Babble. This climb begins in the gully below the Shooting Gallery and to the left of the Visions Wall. Scramble up the gully for 40 feet and the belayer can tie off to a fixed line. Step up out of the gully and clip the first bolt. The route generally ascends the right arete until the sixth bolt. At this point you can continue to the top of the Shard using gear in the cracks to the left of the arete. Stay on the arete to avoid loose rock. For a sport version of this route, step right after clipping the fifth or sixth bolt and traverse to the belay ledge at the start of

Bambi Slayer

.
content.protection: Trad version: 6 bolts and a few pieces to 2". Sport version 6 draws and a couple slings.
content.location: Right edge of the Tower of Babble.

content.description:
Babble-On climbs the obvious sharp arete facing the Visions Wall. The route is distinguished by an incredible overhanging finish.

There are three optional starts; the offwidth to the left, the mossed over bolt line on the right, or the moderately mossed crack on the far right.

Pitch two makes the approach worth it. Place a #1 off the belay and climb past three bolts on a sharp layback arete (incredibly sharp and tenuous). Alternatively walk right on the ledge, then up and left 4th class to skip that finger slicing crux. Easier terrain leads to the incredible overhanging arete. Make a big throw, let your feet cut, and enjoy!

Edit: The "offwidth" to the left is the best approach pitch in my opinion.
content.protection:
18 draws, #1 cam.

Plus gear depending on your approach pitch.
